meanings.definition: To act with restraint or subtlety in a performance.
meanings.sent1: She was underacting in the school play, portraying her character with a quiet grace.
meanings.sent2: The actor underacted during the emotional scene, showing only a hint of sadness.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the underacting student accidentally made everyone laugh with their calm demeanor.
meanings.sent4: His underacting was like a gentle breeze in the storm of exaggerated performances.
meanings.sent5: The underacting in her role made the audience lean in, trying to catch every subtle gesture.

meanings.definition: To perform with less intensity or emotion than expected.
meanings.sent1: The singer was underacting during the concert, singing softly instead of belting out the high notes.
meanings.sent2: In the movie, the villain underacted his evil intentions, making his character seem more mysterious.
meanings.sent3: The underacting magician pretended to struggle with a simple trick, surprising everyone with the grand finale.
meanings.sent4: Her underacting in the play was like a whisper in a room full of shouts.
meanings.sent5: The underacting of the detective kept the audience guessing until the very end of the mystery.
